name: Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site
description: Built by of one of the first families of wealth in America. Designed by one of the nation's preeminent architects. The Vanderbilt Mansion is a home built expressly for the aristocratic lifestyle.
shortDescription: Built by of one of the first families of wealth in America. Designed by one of the nation's preeminent architects. The Vanderbilt Mansion is a home built expressly for the aristocratic lifestyle.

operatingHours.description: Tours of the mansion are offered daily.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description: Entrance to the Vanderbilt Mansion is by guided tour only.

climate.weatherDescription: Spring: Temperatures usually range from 40°F to 70°F. Rain is not uncommon. Summer: Temperatures usually range from 70° F to 100° F. Humidity can be high throughout the summer months with periods of rain. Fall: Temperatures usually range from 40° F to 70° F. Peak leaf season is mid-October. Rain is not uncommon. Winter: Temperatures usually range from 30° F to 50°F. Ice, Freezing Rain and Snow are not uncommon.

images.title: Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site
images.caption: A misty Spring morning at the Vanderbilt Mansion

images.title: Vanderbilt Mansion National Historic Site
images.altText: Fall Colors in the Hudson Valley
images.caption: Thousands of visitors flock to the Hudson Valley in the Fall to see the leaves change colors.

images.title: The F. W. Vanderbilt Formal Gardens
images.caption: The formal gardens of the Vanderbilt Estate consist of multiple tiers defined over a hillside, surrounded by a graceful landscape.

images.title: Overlook
images.altText: View of the Hudson River looking North from the Overlook
images.caption: The inspiring historic view of the Hudson River from the Overlook at Vanderbilt Mansion.

images.title: Summer Concert Series
images.altText: West Point Band performs at the Vanderbilt Mansion
images.caption: West Point Band performs at Vanderbilt Mansion, part of the Summer Concert Series.
